subject: p14851532
Findings: Interval placement of feeding tube, which coils in the stomach, and subsequently courses cephalad with distal tip directed cephalad above the level of the clavicles within the proximal thoracic esophagus. Exam is otherwise remarkable for improving pulmonary edema and slight decrease in mass-like opacity at left apex which has been more fully evaluated by prior CT. Left retrocardiac opacity and bilateral pleural effusions appear similar. Nurse was informed of the malposition of the feeding tube at 8:10 pm. On by telephone at the time of discovery.
